intro: Erysimum sulfureum, commonly known as the sulfur yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its showy flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
